title: TVLine Items: Queer Eye Trailer, Baking Show’s Celebrity Holiday Preview and More

author: Vlada Gelman
excerpt: 'Queer Eye' unveils Season 9 trailer, featuring new cast member Jeremiah Brent -- watch now!
text: TVLine Items: Queer Eye Trailer, Baking Show’s Celebrity Holiday Preview and MoreNew Queer Eye cast member Jeremiah Brent gets a taste for tears in the first trailer for Season 9. Brent takes over for Bobby Berk as the show’s interior design expert, joining returning hosts Antoni Porowski (food and wine), Jonathan Van Ness (beauty), Karamo Brown (culture) and Tan France (fashion). Queer Eye Season 9 premieres with all 10 episodes on Wednesday, Dec. 11, on Netflix. Ready for some more recent newsy nuggets? Well… * Lifetime has greenlit two new original “Ripped from the Headlines” movies: Terror Comes Knocking: The Marcela Borges Story, which stars Dascha Polanco (Orange Is the New Black) and premieres Saturday, Jan. 11; and The Girl in the Garage: The Laura Cowan Story, which stars Paige Hurd (Power Book II: Ghost) and premieres Saturday, Jan. 18. * Paramount+ has announced that As1One: The Israeli-Palestiniain Pop Music Journey —  a four-part, coming-of-age docuseries based on the lives the world’s first mixed Israeli-Palestinian pop group — will premiere Tuesday, Dec. 3. * Roku Channel has released a trailer for The Great American Baking Show: Celebrity Holiday Season 3, premiering Thursday, Nov. 21: * Prime Video has released a trailer for Secret Level, its adult animated anthology series featuring “original stories set within the worlds of some of the most beloved video games”; episodes begin dropping Tuesday, Dec. 10: Which of today’s TVLine Items pique your interest?
html:
TVLine Items: Queer Eye Trailer, Baking Show’s Celebrity Holiday Preview and More

New Queer Eye cast member Jeremiah Brent gets a taste for tears in the first trailer for Season 9.

Brent takes over for Bobby Berk as the show’s interior design expert, joining returning hosts Antoni Porowski (food and wine), Jonathan Van Ness (beauty), Karamo Brown (culture) and Tan France (fashion).

Queer Eye Season 9 premieres with all 10 episodes on Wednesday, Dec. 11, on Netflix.

Ready for some more recent newsy nuggets? Well…

* Lifetime has greenlit two new original “Ripped from the Headlines” movies: Terror Comes Knocking: The Marcela Borges Story, which stars Dascha Polanco (Orange Is the New Black) and premieres Saturday, Jan. 11; and The Girl in the Garage: The Laura Cowan Story, which stars Paige Hurd (Power Book II: Ghost) and premieres Saturday, Jan. 18.

* Paramount+ has announced that As1One: The Israeli-Palestiniain Pop Music Journey —  a four-part, coming-of-age docuseries based on the lives the world’s first mixed Israeli-Palestinian pop group — will premiere Tuesday, Dec. 3.

* Roku Channel has released a trailer for The Great American Baking Show: Celebrity Holiday Season 3, premiering Thursday, Nov. 21:

* Prime Video has released a trailer for Secret Level, its adult animated anthology series featuring “original stories set within the worlds of some of the most beloved video games”; episodes begin dropping Tuesday, Dec. 10:

Which of today’s TVLine Items pique your interest?
